body.p:
Augusta Ky. Dec. 3d 1863
Hon. F. L. Cleveland
Dear Sir

Enclosed you will please find a copy of petition to our Gov. for the remission of a fine inflicted upon G. S. Kimberley of our County. The papers will explain themselves. You will see the reasons urged by Kimberly that the fine should be remitted, instead of respited. The names to the petition you know are the very best citizens of Foster & vicinity, & its statements must therefore be taken as true, & if true, I think it a conclusive case for Executive clemency. See the Gov. & lay Kimberly,s letter & the petition again before him, & with your endorsement of the excellent character of the Petitioners I am satisfied the Gov. will remit
the fine. The man is poor, and bears a good reputation for industry & morality. He is a Cousin of James Staton our Commissioner.
These papers were received the morning after you left, & mailed the day of their reception to you. I expect they will reach Frankfort before you do.
If it is remitted send the evidence thereof to me, to my address here.
Hopeing you may have an agreeable session, & your Senatorial career all you wish

I am sincerely your friend
Thornton F. Marshall
